# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_comments_fact)
- **New Data:** where a Pers_No in the source does not exist as an EmployeeNumber in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Pers_No in source and EmployeeNumber in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an EmployeeNumber in the target exists but the same Pers_No doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge__new is created

%%sql  

-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_new 

    AS

-- gets data that matches of CaseReference and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT 
    T1.CommentsDimID                AS CommentsDimID,
    T1.CaseReference                AS CaseReference, 
    T1.StateReferenceID             AS StateReferenceID,
    T1.TypeReferenceID              AS TypeReferenceID,
    T2.SourceSystemID               AS SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from)  AS IngestionDate,
    NULL                            AS ValidTo,
    md5(
        concat(
            IFNULL(T1.CaseReference,'.'), 
            IFNULL(T1.StateReferenceID,'.'), 
            IFNULL(T1.TypeReferenceID,'.')
        ))                          AS RowID,
    'Y'                             AS IsActive,
    T1.IsActive                     AS HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_reading_case_fact T3 ON T3.ReadingCaseID = T1.ReadingCaseID and T3.IsActive= 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_fact T4 ON T4.CaseID = T1.CaseID and T4.IsActive= 'Y'

WHERE
    -- flags new data        
        (   CASE
                WHEN T1.CaseReference = T1.CaseReference AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.CaseReference,'.'), IFNULL(T1.StateReferenceID,'.'), IFNULL(T1.TypeReferenceID,'.'))) <> T1.RowID    -- same employee, changed data
                THEN 'Y'
                WHEN T1.CaseReference IS NULL -- new employee
                THEN 'Y'
                ELSE 'N'
            END  = 'Y' )
    AND T1.CaseReference IS NOT NULL
    AND T1.expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM procedure_reference_grouped)

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge__new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge__changed_rows is created

%%sql

-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 

Select 
    CommentsCaseID, -- surrogate 
    CommentsDimID,
    CaseReference, 
    StateReferenceID,
    TypeReferenceID,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
From checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'

SELECT
    CommentsCaseID, -- surrogate 
    CommentsDimID,
    CaseReference, -- source system id
    StateReferenceID,
    TypeReferenceID,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge
WHERE CaseReference IN (SELECT CaseReference FROM checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_new WHERE CommentsCaseID IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    CommentsCaseID,
    CommentsDimID,
    CaseReference, 
    StateReferenceID,
    TypeReferenceID,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge__changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. Pers_No from SAP HR), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table checkmark_comments_fact.employee_dim is updated

%%sql
-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge AS Target
USING checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.CommentsCaseID = Target.CommentsCaseID

-- For Updates existing rows
WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (CommentsCaseID,
        CommentsDimID,
        CaseReference, 
        StateReferenceID,
        TypeReferenceID,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)  
        VALUES (Source.CommentsCaseID,
        Source.CommentsDimID,
        Source.CaseReference, 
        Source.StateReferenceID,
        Source.TypeReferenceID,
        Source.SourceSystemID, 
        Source.IngestionDate, 
        Source.ValidTo, 
        Source.RowID, 
        Source.IsActive)

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.checkmark_comments_fact is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new CommentsCaseID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY CommentsCaseID NULLS LAST) AS CommentsCaseID, -- surrogate key
    CommentsDimID,
    CaseReference, -- source system id
    StateReferenceID,
    TypeReferenceID,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_reading_case_bridge;
